Hydras:

"Did you see Kitty prime?"hissed hydras in a tauntin tone"our pr=
oblems are linkd with Unicron, that means thatwe have to... join forces to =
defeat it and whoever support him"

> > <NEW - DINOBOT/VICE GRIP>

hey

ly elite
> > soldiers and veterans, perhaps those who fought in the GREAT W=
AR."
> >
> > As much as he enjoyed combat against MAXIMAL OPPRESSORS, the t=
hought of
> > taking a PRIME on in combat along with their personal escort =
would be
> > suicide, even by his standards.
> >
> > If such a powerful sol=
dier was here, then why would he also be attempting to
> > engage in a truc=
e wtih the PREDACONS?
> >
> > DINOBOT offered as a 'suggestion' to HYDRAS, =
"Garner as much intelligence as
> > you can from this newcomer as to waht t=
he circumstances are, and attempt to
> > negotiate for as full a price as y=
ou can for our direct..  Assistance.  So
> > that we might have a full pict=
ure of circumstances."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> SKYSHADOW nodded in agreement as he =
looked to see the image of LEO
> PRIME staring out through the viewscreen, =
able to see only HYDRAS but
> possibly aware that others were looking back =
at him.
> 
> Turning to VICEGRIP there was a chuckle from SKYSHADOW, "Maybe=
 the
> Maximals are planning something, an offensive against us?" He shrugg=
ed
> slightly. "They have been getting more agressive with that Tuscon at
>=
 their head, even if he does seem to be a bit trusting."
> 
> > <NEW - BLAC=
KARACHNIA>
> >
> > At this point, BLACKARACHNIA gave a mental sigh.  WHy di=
d the interesting
> > ones always be the ones that enjoyed playing too much=
?  Smiling back up at
> > CRYOTEK.  "Ohh, I guess you'll have to learn thig=
ns on your own time."
> > Giving a wink, "And I'll enjoy going along with y=
ou for every moment of it."
> >
> > Waiting for HYDRAS and TARANTALUS to gi=
ve out the mission roders to see what
> > she would be made to do as far as=
 retrieval went.
> 
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "Oh I am sure we both have so many thin=
gs to learn." CRYOTEK said in a
> low conspirital whisper, one that was eas=
ily loud enough for most of
> the others to hear. "Things which will be rev=
ealed in their own time."
> He gave her a knowing smile and wink as he turn=
ed his attention to
> HYDRAS and then FRACTYL in turn
> 
> > <OLD - Hydras>=

> >
> > "DO IT!!!" commanded the male at fractyl "AS FAST AS NOW"
> 
> <NE=
W>
> 
> There was a quick jerky nod from FRACTYL, "Yes, of course sir." He
=
> said. "It is just a matter of cross circuiting its internal return
> mech=
anism with its internal beacon, and then inserting my own bit of
> programm=
ing that I have been workiing on . . ."
> 
> FRACTYL flipped the device ove=
r in his hands, his nimble fingers
> manipulating the device. Then it beepe=
d and then pulsed once and then
> began to display a locator signal on its =
small screen.
> 
> "If you take the device it can lead you to the location.=
" FRACTYL
> glanced down at the device and then back up to HYDRAS, "It is n=
ot
> opertaing on standard Maximal or Predacon frequencies a strange
> Unic=
ronian frequency." he said. "In fact the transmission itself is
> using a v=
ersion of Angolmois energy."
> 
> Angolmois Energy, a word used only in hus=
hed whispers. It is an energy
> said to be composed of Unicron's own life e=
nergy, his 'blood' so to
> speak (if he were human) and it is said to have =
strange properties and
> unknown capabilities.
> 
> FRACTYL handed the devi=
ce to HYDRAS.
> 
> "Isn't that the same type of energy we have detected as =
comming from
> that jungle?" CRYOTEK asked, although it is obvious he alrea=
dy knew
> the answer.
> 
> FRACTYL nodded. "Yes."
